atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the `@theme` directive to define your project's custom design tokens, like fonts, colors, and breakpoints.

atDirectives.name: @apply

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@custom-variant` directive to define your own custom variants in your CSS. This allows you to create reusable variants that can be applied to multiple utility classes.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: If you want to add your own default base styles for specific HTML elements, use the `@layer` directive to add those styles to Tailwind's base layer.
